list-item.p: History of chemotherapy, radiation, or administration of other investigational agents for synchronous or metachronous malignancies within 1 year before enrollment.
A patient with a history of acute myocardial infarction, severe angina, congested heart failure, cerebrovascular disease, or pulmonary thrombosis within 6 months before registration.
History of laparotomy or thoracotomy within 4 weeks before treatment begins.
Females who may be pregnant, breastfeeding an infant, and have a desire to bear children.
Any other patients considered to be unsuitable for enrollment by the investigators.
A patient who takes some similar drugs to tranilast.
A patient who received a transfusion within 14 days before enrollment.
